## Estimating Cost of Debt from YTM

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

coupon <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.05, sd = 0.005)
ytm <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.055, sd = 0.005)
tc <- 0.34
```

Aurora Technologies has outstanding bonds with coupon rate **`r round(coupon*100,2)`**% and yield-to-maturity (YTM) **`r round(ytm*100,2)`**%. The corporate tax rate is **`r round(tc*100,0)`**%.

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display:flex;flex-direction:row;gap:6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q14a"><strong>1. What is the after-tax cost of debt (in %)?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q14a" name="module4_num_q14a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width:150px;"
    data-correct-answer=`r round(ytm*(1-tc)*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.01"/>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q14a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ After-tax cost of debt = YTM × (1 − T_c) = **`r round(ytm*(1-tc)*100,2)`**%.
</div>

:::
